aaanalysis.plot_set_legendÔÉÅ

aaanalysis.plot_set_legend(ax=None, handles=None, dict_color=None, list_cat=None, labels=None, y=-0.2, x=0.5, ncol=3, fontsize=11, weight='normal', lw=0, edgecolor=None, return_handles=False, loc='upper left', labelspacing=0.2, columnspacing=1, title=None, fontsize_legend=None, title_align_left=True, fontsize_weight='normal', shape=None, **kwargs)[source]ÔÉÅ

Set a customizable legend for a plot.

Parameters:

  • ax (matplotlib.axes.Axes, default=None) ‚Äì The axes to attach the legend to.

  • handles (list, default=None) ‚Äì Handles for legend items.

  • dict_color (dict, default=None) ‚Äì A dictionary mapping categories to colors.

  • list_cat (list, default=None) ‚Äì List of categories to include in the legend.

  • labels (list, default=None) ‚Äì Labels for legend items.

  • y (float, default=-0.2) ‚Äì The y-coordinate for the legend‚Äôs anchor point.

  • x (float, default=0.5) ‚Äì The x-coordinate for the legend‚Äôs anchor point.

  • ncol (int, default=3) ‚Äì Number of columns in the legend.

  • fontsize (int, default=11) ‚Äì Font size for the legend text.

  • weight (str, default='normal') ‚Äì Weight of the font.

  • lw (float, default=0) ‚Äì Line width for legend items.

  • edgecolor (color, default=None) ‚Äì Edge color for legend items.

  • return_handles (bool, default=False) ‚Äì Whether to return handles and labels.

  • loc (str, default='upper left') ‚Äì Location for the legend.

  • labelspacing (float, default=0.2) ‚Äì Vertical spacing between legend items.

  • columnspacing (int, default=1) ‚Äì Horizontal spacing between legend columns.

  • title (str, default=None) ‚Äì Title for the legend.

  • fontsize_legend (int, default=None) ‚Äì Font size for the legend title.

  • title_align_left (bool, default=True) ‚Äì Whether to align the title to the left.

  • fontsize_weight (str, default='normal') ‚Äì Font weight for the legend title.

  • shape (str, default=None) ‚Äì Marker shape for legend items.

  • **kwargs (dict) ‚Äì Additional arguments passed directly to ax.legend() for finer control.

Returns:

ax ‚Äì The axes with the legend applied.

Return type:

matplotlib.axes.Axes

See also

matplotlib.pyplot.legend

For additional details on how the ‚Äòloc‚Äô parameter can be customized.

matplotlib.lines.Line2D

For additional details on the different types of marker shapes (‚Äòshape‚Äô parameter).

Examples

>>> import aaanalysis as aa
>>> aa.plot_set_legend(ax=ax, dict_color={'Cat1': 'red', 'Cat2': 'blue'}, shape='o')
